column4: hello, after upgrading to new version my nm-applet and volume control applet disappeared, tray is not missing and nm-applet --sm-disabled exists in autostart applications, when i run nm-applet manually into console, nm-applet icon will show up
ru running gnome?
yup
okay right click on an used portion of the task bar, left click on add to panel, then left click on indicator applet
note this works in 10.10 dunno about 11.04
!sound | faryshta
it does not work for network manager applet
oops I though you said volume control
volume control does not work also, but this is not as problematic as missing network manager plugin
let me schlep for a sec
i dont understand it, command which should start nm-applet is already present in autostart applications but it wont start after login, each time i log gin i need to type nm-applet into terminal
ok
you do have a notification area, right?
yes i do
worth a shot:  http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=423543
see # 4
will check it
best I could find -- not tried it personally
this is not my problem, i can start nm-applet manually .. but it wont start automatically after logging in
and this tells you how to fix that.
iow System/Preferences/Startup Applications/Options/ click on automatically remember running apps when logging out -- then click remember currently running apps
